long_description: Incorporating feedback from backcountry professionals and athletes, the redesigned Osprey Kode 22 ski pack offers logical organization and sharp style for riders seeking quick off-piste forays. Wide ski loops and glove-friendly buckles let you carry skis diagonally or A-frame style; reinforced front-panel and hipbelt wings allow vertical or horizontal snowboard carry. Anatomically shaped shoulder straps, hipbelt and back panel feature supportive EVA foam padding; adjustable sternum strap features a whistle built into the buckle. Internal HDPE frame sheet provides structural support and transfers load weight to the hips. Pack volume easily fits the tools you need for a quick run of backcountry fun; improved access and organization offer convenience and aid in emergencies where speed matters. Back-panel entry to the main compartment allows access to gear when carrying skis or a snowboard and helps keep the back panel, shoulder straps and hipbelt out of the snow. Zippered protective sleeve with external drain and insulated tube route accommodate a reservoir (sold separately); zippered interior pocket helps keep small items organized. Extra-large, front-panel J-zipper ensures fast access to the avalanche-kit pocket, even when a board or skis are attached; inside sleeves hold shovel handles and probes. Stowable stretch-mesh at the top lets you secure a helmet; attachment loop lets you lash on an ice tool. The Osprey Kode 22 ski pack also features reinforced wear points, a scratch-free goggles pocket and zippered hipbelt pockets.
